msgSnippet: You are right. The tests takes a long while to run and is really frustrating, but I could not come up with a solution. Maybe I am missing something here. The
messageBody:
You are right. The tests takes a long while to run and is really
frustrating, but I could not come up with a solution.

Maybe I am missing something here. The logic in the database is rather
complicated and the accuracy of queries is one of the most important thing
in the application. Now my question is how can I mock hibernate in a way
that to test accuracy of my query? I would appreciate any advise here.

Regards,
Arash

On 9/28/07, Stephen Smith <steve@...> wrote:
>
> Hi,
>
> I consider myself more of a mockist TDD practitioner than a classicist
> these days - I would strongly advocate mocking to
> keep your tests fast and simple. Why test a third party application such
> as Hibernate? That's not your job, surely?
>
> If you want to test your classes which use Hibernate, mock the actual
> Hibernate classes within your code and write some
> behaviour driven tests, e.g. "my fetch method calls Hibernate with this
> HQL". That way you ensure you're using Hibernate
> in the right way.
>
> I'd also advocate writing tests against your Hibernate config... test
> _how_ you use a third party application like
> Spring or Hibernate, but not the third party application itself.
>
> S
>
> ---
> Stephen Smith, MEng (Wales).
> http://www.stephen-smith.co.uk/
>
